Class MyAnimeListAuthenticator.LocalServerBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kttdevelopment.mal4j.MyAnimeListAuthenticator.LocalServerBuilder
  • Enclosing class:
    MyAnimeListAuthenticator
    public static final class MyAnimeListAuthenticator.LocalServerBuilder
extends Object
    Creates a MyAnimeList Authenticator by deploying a local server to authenticate the user.

    • Method Detail

      • openBrowser

        public final MyAnimeListAuthenticator.LocalServerBuilder openBrowser()
        Indicates that the authorization page should be opened in the user's browser automatically.
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.1.0
        See Also:
        openBrowser(boolean)

      • openBrowser

        public final MyAnimeListAuthenticator.LocalServerBuilder openBrowser​(boolean openBrowser)
        If true, a browser will automatically be opened to the authorization page. Note that if this is false you will have to go to the page manually using MyAnimeListAuthenticator.getAuthorizationURL(String, String), MyAnimeListAuthenticator.getAuthorizationURL(String, String, String), or MyAnimeListAuthenticator.getAuthorizationURL(String, String, String, String).
        Parameters:
        openBrowser - if browser should be opened
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.1.0
        See Also:
        openBrowser()

      • setTimeout

        public final MyAnimeListAuthenticator.LocalServerBuilder setTimeout​(int timeout)
        Sets how long (in seconds) that the server will expire in. Once the timeout has passed a new authentication builder must be used.
        Parameters:
        timeout - server timeout
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • setRedirectURI

        public final MyAnimeListAuthenticator.LocalServerBuilder setRedirectURI​(String redirectURI)
        Sets the application redirect URI. Only required if your application has more than one redirect URI registered.
        Parameters:
        redirectURI - redirect URI
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • setURLCallback

        public final MyAnimeListAuthenticator.LocalServerBuilder setURLCallback​(Consumer<String> consumer)
        Sets the auth URL callback method. Used to retrieve the URL that generates the authorization code. Runs in its own thread.
        This method can be used to handle the auth URL in the case that the system doesn't support the openBrowser() method.
        Parameters:
        consumer - consumer
        Returns:
        builder
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        Consumer

      • build

        public final MyAnimeListAuthenticator build()
                                     throws IOException
        Returns the built authenticator.
        Returns:
        authenticator
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if port was invalid, or client id or redirect URI was malformed
        BindException - if port was blocked
        IOException - if server could not be started
        UnauthorizedAccessException - if request was intercepted by an unauthorized source
        NullPointerException - if server was closed before the client could be authorized
        HttpException - if client request failed
        Since:
        1.1.0
        See Also:
        MyAnimeListAuthenticator
